column4: so... what do i need to change in xorg.conf, and if i get it wrong will it break my computer??
You can also sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg ;)
What card do you have?
Don't know what video card? eeeg... :P
Go to terminal and type --- lspci | grep -i vga
just pick intel :)
You're golden - intel drivers work great... though you might not get right resolution right off... easy fix.... And you can run desktop effects out of the box...
Erp, yeah sorry -- i8X  or i9X if available ....
Should be 02:00 based on what you had above...
You didn't do autodetect for dpkg ?
Start dpkg again and have it autodetect :)
You'll get it, hang in there...
You can call it something if you want :)
I think it's 02:00 based on what you pasted from lspci
Ermm.. Dunno in the space provided?
You cna hit tab or something to go down to it and edit or is a default number there?
I think it should be 2:00 that was detected...
Was it 2:00?
THat should sort out the display - resolution might not be quite right, but that's an easy fix...
Yep.. as it's picking up current settings...
Pick native for your screen and the other pop ones if you like 1024x768 and so forth..
What is native resolution of your monitor - is it an LCD?
